cyclone.name: DELTA
cyclone.current_location: about 550 miles SSE of Cameron, Louisiana
cyclone.trajectory: tracking northwest across the central Gulf, then turning north-northwest and north toward the central Louisiana coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: central Louisiana coast near Vermilion Bay/Pecan Island to Port Fourchon

weather_observation.watch_coast: High Island TX to Grand Isle LA (Hurricane Watch); east of Grand Isle LA to Bay St. Louis MS including New Orleans (Tropical Storm Watch)
weather_observation.warning_coast: None for U.S. Gulf Coast as of this advisory
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast from High Island TX eastward to the AL/FL border, especially Louisiana coastline and adjacent bays/lakes
weather_observation.wind: Tropical storm-force winds are likely Friday with a 48% chance; gusts to hurricane force possible during the afternoon/evening as the core passes inland.
weather_observation.storm_surge: 3–5 ft of surge possible in Lake Pontchartrain and Lake Maurepas which connect to the port’s waterway system.
weather_observation.rainfall: 4–8 inches with isolated 12 inches Friday–Saturday could cause flash and river flooding along the Mississippi River corridor serving the port.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Scattered tornadoes Friday; hazardous seas, rip currents, and restricted vessel movements beginning late Thursday.
